title: Surface Polarity Dynamics in Oxygen-Deintercalated Nickelate Thin Films
content: Surface polarity plays a pivotal role in influencing the electronic and structural characteristics of oxide thin films by virtue of electrostatic effects. A comprehensive understanding of the underlying mechanisms necessitates a profound insight into the atomic structure and electrostatic properties at the surface interface. Leveraging advanced four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4D-STEM), a technique acknowledged for its capability to concurrently reconstruct atomic structures and electric field maps, as previously demonstrated in other material systems [1, 2], provides a valuable avenue for elucidating these intricate phenomena.
